questions.question: Maintenance activities are constrained by the existing architecture and code.
Which maintenance model applies changes directly to the code with minimal analysis?
Iterative development and incremental development are interchangeable terms in software engineering.
What is the second stage in the Staged Model for CSS lifecycle?
The reuse-oriented model emphasizes reusing components from older systems.
What mechanism allows tracking multiple versions of software components?
Which version control strategy prevents conflicts by locking files during modification?
Acceptance testing is performed during the initial development phase.
Which process ensures the traceability and integrity of software system changes?
The iterative enhancement model propagates changes from high-level documents down to the code.
The full reuse model builds new systems by modifying and integrating existing components.
Which testing phase involves customer representatives to validate the system?
The initial development stage in the Staged Model involves frequent architectural changes.
Servicing primarily focuses on maintaining the system with minimal architectural changes.
Which version control technique allows parallel development of features?
Which phase validates the modified system against the original requirements?
In the Staged Model, the 'phase-out' stage involves preparing for system retirement.
Which reuse-oriented model emphasizes propagating changes from high-level documents to code?
The full reuse model requires the creation of entirely new components.
What acronym refers to managing software configurations effectively?
Configuration management reduces confusion and establishes order in large projects.
In SCM, what term refers to isolating files in a workspace for modification?
What version control strategy allows simultaneous file editing by multiple developers?
System testing ensures that both original and modified requirements are met.
Which maintenance model identifies and modifies components for new system requirements?
What ISO maintenance process activity involves transferring a system to a new environment?
ISO/IEC 14764 describes maintenance as an iterative process for managing modifications.
What configuration item snapshot represents a stable version of a product?
SCM only focuses on managing source code.
Which type of testing ensures that all system components work together?
SCM ensures traceability and control over software artifacts during maintenance.
The Staged Model for CSS does not include a servicing phase.
Which phase involves end-users verifying the system before final release?
Branching in version control enables parallel development paths.
Which SCM feature isolates files for editing and testing without affecting others?
Configuration management is a critical part of the ISO maintenance process.
Which activity in the ISO maintenance process involves transferring a system to a new operational environment?
Changes made during the servicing phase typically do not alter the software architecture.
What version control strategy allows multiple users to modify files simultaneously?
Which phase validates the entire system's functionality and performance?
Which term refers to a stable reference point for configuration items?
What ISO maintenance activity focuses on adapting a system to a new platform?
Which SCM feature manages changes to source code and other artifacts?
Configuration audits verify that the documented configuration matches the actual product.
What process tracks changes and ensures consistency in large-scale software maintenance?
ISO/IEC 14764 describes maintenance activities as iterative.
Which IEEE phase focuses on coding and unit testing modified software?
Releasing a system update includes creating an archival version for backup.
